body:
Nice PR, though this would need some regression tests. Can you add marvin smoke tests around list APis (add them to travis yml file)

tag:needlove

PR is code complete with testing efforts that @borisstoyanov can share

tag:mergeready

@DaanHoogland please rebase against latest master; after that I can help test this in my env. Thanks.

tag:needlove

Good pr, let's ask comments from @remibergsma @DaanHoogland @wido and others?

tag:needlove

LGTM

tag:mergeready
@sudhansu7 rebase against master and push -f, squash changes to a single commit, thanks

@dsclose rebase against master, squash changes to a single commit, thanks

tag:needlove

test_deploy_vm_userdata_MultiNic.py script is added for the verification of this Bug. It will verify that a user can deploy MultiNic VM when non-default nic does not have userdata service and can also update vm userdata.

Before Fix, below was the result:-

Test userdata update when non default nic is without userdata ... === TestName: test_deployvm_multiNic | Status : FAILED ===
FAIL

FAIL: Test userdata update when non default nic is without userdata

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/pmanthen/test_deploy_vm_userdata_MultiNic.py", line 183, in test_deployvm_multiNic
    self.fail("Failed to update userdata: %s" % e)
AssertionError: Failed to update userdata: Execute cmd: updatevirtualmachine failed, due to: errorCode: 530, errorText:Service UserData is not supported in the network id=237
-------------------- >> begin captured stdout << ---------------------
=== TestName: test_deployvm_multiNic | Status : FAILED ===

[failed_plus_exceptions.txt](https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/files/245103/failed_plus_exceptions.txt)
[results.txt](https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/files/245104/results.txt)
[runinfo.txt](https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/files/245105/runinfo.txt)

After the Fix:-

Test userdata update when non default nic is without userdata for deploy and update ... === TestName: test_deployvm_multinic | Status : SUCCESS ===
ok

---

Ran 1 test in 40.583s

OK

[results.txt](https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/files/245106/results.txt)
[runinfo.txt](https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/files/245107/runinfo.txt)

I will make sure this gets into 4.9 because I think it is really needed.  We do need one more LGTM on the code.  Also, since this PR does have some implications regarding access to the system we should be pretty cautious.  I am pretty confident with a new install because that is what my CI has tested.  I think it would be prudent for us to do more testing of some upgrade scenarios to make sure the code behaves as expected.  I don't think this code should come into play with upgrades because the old properties files should be read, but I think we need to validate the code behaves as expected.  Has anyone tested this yet?

I think we should be testing:
- Upgrading to 4.9 and NOT using this feature.
- Upgrading to 4.9 and running the `migrate-dynamicroles.py` script to import the existing roles.
@swill apart from the PR author, it would be great if at least one more reviewer can share a screenshot; please proceed as per your discretion
@rhtyd I'd love to. But I never used the Redundant VR, so I can't tell.
Created new PR on master: https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/pull/1526

@rhtyd in general, I agree with you.  The main blocker with that is the fact that very few people have the ability to test regional templates.  The code is pretty straight forward too, so that helps our confidence in the change...

@pdube do you have the ability to test this PR with our swift setup to verify it works as expected?

@rhtyd better tag with tag:easypr

the logic is that this need not be executed on ssvm or cpvm

code looks good and functionally sane but this needs extensive testing. Especially when master fails the dns functionality needs to be still available, i.e. be started on the new master. @dsclose did you test this?

Hi @rhtyd since it uses "ls" to get a list of packages, if the directory or .jar file does not exist it is no big deal.  It will output a No such file or directory message but still loads any packages that exist without issue.  the UCP variable still looks good when that occurs.

did a code walk through and saw no extravaganzas and some useful extractions and renamings. As for the functionality, I have no clue. I am not a vmware user, let alone expert but for what it's worth: LGTM
You can close this PR.  Once #1495 is merged, it will be forward merged into 4.8 and master, so this PR is not needed.  Thanks...  :)
Done, thanks @rhtyd @swill @rafaelweingartner
Sure @rhtyd, I'll add them. I was working on it based on @koushik-das suggestion but I still have to work on it.
Running CI now...

I think the two commits are fine in this case, so just leave it as it is.  ğŸ‘ 

Can we get some LGTM code reviews on this one?  Thanks...
@rhtyd is there a reason you want him to rebase to master?  We still support 4.7, so all fixes to that branch will be forward merged to 4.8 and master.  I think this PR can stay open against 4.7.
I am also fine with these being separate commits as they are functionally separate.

Squash yes, but this can remain open against 4.7 as we are still fixing bugs and such against 4.7 and it is still supported (until 4.9 is released).  Anything merged into 4.7 will be forward merged...
@rhtyd rebased, as these are several different commits by different people from different companies, I will not squash it.

Marvin tests where successful. Testing community submission of OOBM, which includes end to end regression testing with IPMI simulator. Issue power state commands and stage transition, configuration and password management and testing of feature enablement on separate layers of infrastructure. 

LGTM.


@remibergsma requires force push again.  Travis timed out...
I think this one is ready to merge...
@jburwell I will be doing a group of merges in a couple of hours which will include this one.  If you have any pending concerns with this one, speak up soon.  :)
How do I test this and verify it is working?
We are missing one code review on this one.
I need some code reviews on this one.  Also, @DaanHoogland you may have to push again.  Our lovely checkers are being annoying again...
@kiwiflyer do you have test results on this one?  Thanks...
We need more more code review on this one...
Need to run CI against this one to verify...
I don't have the ability to test HyperV.  Can anyone verify this PR for me?

@rafaelweingartner @cristofolini I refactored unit tests based on your comments, I also removed testStorageNfsVersionNotPresent as it is covered by tests checkStorageProcessorAndHandlerNfsVersionAttributeVersionSet and checkStorageProcessorAndHandlerNfsVersionAttributeVersionNotSet
@wido is this code currently deployed and working in your prod environment?  @rhtyd any suggestions for validating this code before merge?  Have you tested this?
I need some code reviews here.  @jburwell can you let me know what that status of your review is?
Missing one code review on this one.  @rafaelweingartner?  I saw you post in this thread, so I am calling you out.  :P
@rhtyd rebase and squash done
@swill  I'm a bit behind. I'm building this now.
No worries.  Thanks...  I also am a bit behind.  I apparently have to just assume I won't get any work done on mondays.  :P
@rafaelweingartner This one seems to be in OK shape.  I am missing one code review, given that you have actively reviewed this code, can I get your final status?

We are still accepting bug fixes in 4.7 and 4.8, but all features should be added to master.  Anything merged into 4.7 or 4.8 will be forward merged up through master.  I agree, this probably should be opened against master.
All tests have passed on this and we have the required number of code reviews.  There are no merge conflicts, so I think we should be fine to merge this PR as is.  Any objections?

That change makes sense to me.
I do now if I have installed the â€œbzip2â€ program without noticing while installing some other tool, but in my MSs Servers it was already installed.
Anyways I can give LGTM here.
I think this one is ready to merge given the scope of the change.  Thanks...
LGTM, considdered it implied by the test report but here it is.

@swill I've validated the lock logic in a gist above, I've tested the elusiveness of critical code that runs when a lock is acquired; security groups is implemented using ebtables (rules on bridges) therefore this script is run at hypervisor host (kvm in this case, by the agent) -- the changes ensure that no two executions of this script are allowed at the same time

as for prod testing, @wido can you comment on testing the changes in this PR, thanks

Thanks @DaanHoogland -- though there is a way to run ESXi6 with vCenter 6 on KVM (http://rohit.yadav.xyz/logs/vmware-esxi-vcenter-on-kvm-cloudstack)

/cc @swill this is ready for merge now, thanks
@DaanHoogland please rebase and push -f again, to re-kickoff Travis; I'll review and test this change soon against a real KVM env tomorrow

@DaanHoogland thanks...

@sudhansu7 can you do a force push to kick off the travis run again so we can get this PR green.  Thx...

fair enough, LGTM

tag:mergeready
I am missing code reviews on this one...
Thanks @milamberspace cc @swill @DaanHoogland we need one more LGTM

LGTM, @swill @wido @resmo @nvazquez @nlivens @koushik-das and others - one more LGTM needed

tag:easypr

@swill, 
I did a review on the comments and discussions to get me up to date (we had a discussion about some code duplications). Those discussions were pretty good, I believe that there was some block of code being repeated, and also some blocks (or lines I do not recall) that were never used or not needed.

I did a code walkthrough and I cannot say anything about the code. It is very good now. I can for sure give an LGMT here ;)

Sorry guys to say this, but, those discussions were not merely about cosmetics!
#1515 is going in today and then we will validate that this one and #1376 don't have merge conflicts once #1515 is in and they will follow right after...

@rafaelweingartner thanks for the review.  :)  I think what @rhtyd meant is anything outstanding is only cosmetic, I don't think he meant the entire discussion.

I think this one is ready to merge...
@swill I have gotten diverted from review.  Hoping to pick up today.
Code LGTM
@jburwell no worries, I know how that goes.  :)  Thanks for your support regardless...
Thanks @nvazquez, I think this one is ready now...

@swill and @rhtyd: The code in the PR is currently in production at PCextreme and running fine.

With a 'with' statement in Python I couldn't get a proper lock. But that's not really a functional change, it's merely a more Python-way of writing code.

I am pretty comfortable with this because @wido is already using this.  I don't have an SG environment setup right now for testing, so I would have to build one specifically to test this.  Do you guys agree this is ready to merge?

Hi @swill no problem, you might be calling me on other PRs, and I might have not answered you. Sadly, duty is calling these days, few papers were accepted and now I have to work with all of those bureaucracy and also I have to get a camera ready version; that I why I haven't had much time to be around here lately. If it is something important you can send me an email.

I have just re-checked this one.
Although I find the addition of â€œfinalâ€ everywhere something that was not needed; @DaanHoogland knows that I am very picky sometimes ;). What was promised by the PR description was implemented here, and I am ok with that. 

LGTM here too.
gogogo

@swill I think you want to forward merge before this one and then merge -s ours or such to prevent this from being merged forward.
4.8 has its own transifex stuff.
We need another code review.  How should I test this, does it have to be a manual test?

Here is an integration test for this:

[TestAddRemoveHosts.py.txt](https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/files/245702/TestAddRemoveHosts.py.txt)
@DaanHoogland this is opened against `master` though while #1515 is opened against `4.8`, so the forward merge of #1515 will affect this one...
ok, the other way around, but you get what I am warning for.
@DaanHoogland I think this PR should probably be opened against the `4.7` branch though in order for your point to be valid.  Right?
How should I test this?  I think this is in a pretty good place pending some verification...

@swill @DaanHoogland Yes, on my local machine, the branch are open against thr 4.7 branch. The PR in github is against the master, but will be against 4.7.
I can close and open a new PR (4.7) if you want.

this does not work for me as well.
If there are multiple public interfaces in the VR, only the last one works.

Here are the results of my automated regression test:

test_add_remove_host_with_solidfire_plugin (TestAddRemoveHosts.TestAddRemoveHosts) ... === TestName: test_add_remove_host_with_solidfire_plugin | Status : SUCCESS ===
ok

---

Ran 1 test in 520.682s

OK
@milamberspace I think that is probably the best option.  Then I will merge the new one (with these changes) first and forward merge and then merge #1515 and then if no conflicts #1376.

Just an update, 
I forgot to ask, can you squash the commits?
I think this one it is better to have all of the changes into a single commit.

I'm not familiar with that block of code, remi's changes and justification seem fine though.....
Some very oddly/badly worded variable names.
@rafaelweingartner I squashed them, thanks for your comments and reviews!
lgtm

@swill ok I will do this. But you must understand that the L10N resources files for each CS version are different and cannot merge together. On the Transifex website (used for the translation) each CS version has its own resources files.
The others RM merged directly my PRs (about the L10N) without forward merge after. It is not necessary (and probably counter-productive)
Previous PR was #1374, for book keeping...

I pulled this into a hardware lab on 4.8.1.  I setup a number of fake clients and hammered 8250. Prior to the patch the agents end up in a disconnected state after a few minutes.

I applied the patch and my little DOS test is unable to affect the connectivity between the management server and the agents.

I also tested some provisioning activities and made sure the agent survived taking the management server down and then bringing it back up.

LGTM

Thank you @kiwiflyer.  ğŸ‘ 

@rhtyd can you force push this PR again to try to get Jenkins green?  Thanks...  Otherwise this one is ready...
@kiwiflyer and @rhtyd I've been troubleshooting the proxy issue and it was an issue in my environment!  i have things worked out and everything works fine.

@swill no objection, let's merge this

tag:mergeready
@swill yes that's what I meant, therefore commented that it's ready for merge. Thanks.
LGTM based on the discussion

Obviously this merge conflict exists because something has been refactored in master which was not merged into previous versions.  We need to understand what was done and how to make sure both functionality can exist together...  I had to run to catch a train when I ran into this, so I have not gotten too deep into which PR was merged into master which is conflicting with this.
